Player_Romus

Then democracy arrived in the kingdom.

Narrator

Power had been a fragile thing, bestowed and then forcibly taken away. In the Citadel, days had turned into weeks. 

The same walls that had once confined many during your reign now held you captive.

You...

Player_Romus

...found bitter irony in this cruel twist of fate.

Narrator

Vina wasted no time visiting, sharing how well things were going with her and Axel Reinhart in Pales. 

She extended an invitation to your mother and you to build a life together there. 

You decided...

Player_Romus

...to remain in Rizia, requesting for her to visit you soon.

Player_Romus

...you didn't want family tying you down.

Narrator

The ambassador Nicolas Rembrandteur and the Foreign Minister Laurent Martell were present at the evening.\n\nAxel introduced them to you and you charmed them with your...

Narrator

Rumors seeped through the prison walls. The coupists had crushed Rizia's nascent democracy. \n\nThe Parliament, once a beacon of hope, had become nothing but a stillborn dream.

Player_Romus

...counted each day, a silent rebellion against your fate.

Player_Romus

It seemed pointless now, worrying about what could have been.

Player_Romus

...through the royal decree of King Taddeus Azaro, your life is spared, your honor restored, and your family's sanctity upheld.

Player_Romus

...moved to a hut in Zpana's nature.

Player_Romus

.....settled seaside in Topes, near the ancient Rezenid sites.

Narrator

Fully free at last, life could begin anew. For the first time since birth, choosing your destiny was in your hands.

Player_Romus

...wife, Lucita.

Player_Romus

...by the royal decree of Queen Lucita Azaro, your sentence is to be extended by an additional month.

Player_Romus

...mother, Estela.

Player_Romus

...life partner, Pabel.

Narrator

Pabel immediately agreed to come with you to the east coast of Valenqiris.

You found a delightful house with a stunning sea view, nestled near historical landmarks.

You...

Narrator

Estela welcomed the change and journeyed with you to the east coast of Valenqiris.\n\nOnce there, you...

Narrator

Life with Pabel was fulfilling, despite the occasional odd looks and attitudes from locals. When you were together, everything else seemed trivial. \n\nIn this newfound contentment, you spent more time...

Player_Romus

...the joy of parenthood eclipsed all else.

Narrator

A year later, Vina and Axel visited, bringing a delightful surprise â€“ their daughter, Lena.\n\nIn that moment of familial joy, you...

Narrator

Vina visited often. Now that you were no longer king, your bond felt stronger than ever.\n\nYou...

Narrator

You decided to explore the city of Pales instead. You had never truly gotten to know it before. Now, you...

Player_Romus

...you wanted nothing more than to be a caring grandfather.

Player_Romus

..wandered the historic streets, absorbing the city's rich heritage.

Narrator

Pabel reveled in the city's energy. Your relationship was a blend of public subtlety and private intimacy. \n\nThe elite social circles seemed indifferent, enhancing your sense of freedom. Both Vina and Estela welcomed Pabel, forging new friendships.

Narrator

The sea air was a comfort to your aging mother, though she often yearned for Zille. \n\nYour shared moments, now more profound than ever, were complemented by the lively gatherings and parties Vina frequently organized.

Player_Romus

It was good to spend time with loved ones.

Narrator

After serving the month-long sentence, you emerged from Iza City Prison to a different world. New monuments had risen, and the currency circulated without the familiar imprint of your face. 

Clutching a newspaper, you learned the war at the southern border near the Grand Duchy was still raging. Its ramifications would last years, if not decades.

As you stepped beyond the prison gates, there awaited...

Player_Romus

Your life partner, Pabel.

Player_Romus

Kyrute was the safest option.

Player_Romus

Your life was an open door.

Narrator

The first ever general election in Rizia was nothing short of a spectacle. With an impressive 80% turnout, the people demonstrated their zeal for change.

When it came time to elect a Prime Minister, Manus Sazon gracefully stepped aside to make way for a newcomer. A commoner. 

Adarfo Sotelato championed a sweeping reform agenda, far beyond what you had managed to achieve as king.

In his inaugural speech, he hailed a new era, while relegating your legacy to the past. You...

Player_Romus

...didn't care and just wanted to move on.

Player_Romus

...wrote her a letter congratulating her on her win.

Player_Romus

...wrote him a letter of congratulations.

Narrator

Over time, the security threats diminished, granting you the freedom you'd longed for. \n\nYou rekindled your bonds with friends and acquaintances you hadn't seen since taking the throne.

Narrator

A chilling announcement halted the nation: a limited nuclear exchange had ravaged Holsord and parts of Rumburg.\n\nThe AN's swift intervention brought a respite from nuclear hostilities within 72 hours, though conventional conflicts in East Merkopa escalated.

Narrator

An alarming broadcast interrupted your day: Rumburg was under invasion by the Republic of Sordland. \n\nThe toll was already steep, with no end in sight. While Rumburg was distant, its impact was felt in Rizia, where Rumburgian refugees were reluctant to return to their war-torn homeland.

Player_Romus

...a sense of relief wash over you.

Player_Romus

...hopeful about the future unfolding.

Player_Romus

...a pang of regret for your past reign's shortcomings.

Narrator

Queen Vina Toras, your daughter and the new monarch, quickly endeared herself to the populace, earning the affectionate title of 'People's Queen.' 

Shortly after her coronation, she initiated a sweeping campaign to eradicate poverty that proved both popular and effective. 

Gratefully, she acknowledged your contributions to the nation.

Player_Romus

Long live the new King.

Player_Romus

...let the Palace staff do most of the work.

Narrator

Over time, the security threats diminished, granting you the freedom you'd longed for. \n\nYou immediately sought out Pabel. At long last, the two of you could be together without fear.

Player_Romus

...felt reassured by her approach to maintain unity.

Player_Romus

...immersing yourself in study and knowledge.

Player_Romus

Vina was expecting a child.

Player_Romus

...tending to the gardens.

Narrator

The birth of Queen Lucita's son {RiziaDLCText.KingsSon} sparked jubilation throughout the kingdom.\n\nAs a father for the second time, you...

Player_Romus

A few weeks passed.

Player_Romus

Then democracy arrived in the kingdom.

Took up hunting as a hobby.

Started farming, cultivating your own crops.

Managed the local tourism center, occasionally guiding.

Took up fishing as a pastime.

Engaged in poetry, joined art circles.

Performed standup, reminiscing about your days as king.

Relaxed and made new friends.

Player_Romus

Relaxed and reveled in your sudden free time.

Narrator

Lucita followed you to Iza. Together, you dove into the bustling urban culture there.\n\nYou...

Player_Romus

...kept writing letters to him in jail.

Player_Romus

Things could be much worse in life.

Player_Romus

...you could balance your time between helping with Lena and pursuing your own interests.

Narrator

Embracing grandfatherhood, you spent countless hours with Lena, witnessing her first steps, her first words. 

The bond you formed with her was irreplaceable, enriching your days with joy and laughter. 

As Lena grew, so did your role in her life.

Narrator

You became a guiding presence in Lena's life while not forgoing your interests. 

The arrangement brought depth to your days, blending family warmth with personal growth. 

As Lena grew older, your relationship evolved. The title of "King Romus" faded from your memory, replaced by the name "Grandfather".

Narrator

Your mother, feeling homesick, chose to visit Zille and reconnect with old friends. \n\nRespecting her need, you saw her off and turned your focus to...

Player_Romus

...immersing in local culture and activities.

Player_Romus

...pursuing hobbies and self-growth.

Player_Romus

...partaking in community social work.

Player_Romus

Guided both children with wisdom and love.

Player_Romus

Dedicated yourself to raising your son wisely.

Player_Romus

Balanced parenting with personal time.

Player_Romus

...sociological challenges specific to the Kingdom of Rizia.

Narrator

Delving into your friend's thesis, a spark reignited within you for politics. 

Motivated, you resolved to pen your own thesis, guided by a distinguished professor. 

The focus of your scholarly work delved into...

Narrator

Over the years, your societal prominence waned. The eight years you spent as king faded in your memory, crowded out by your many other life experiences. \n\nDuring a quiet day at home, you discovered...

Player_Romus

...the teachings of Prophet Hu, the founder of Zaranism.

Player_Romus

...devote more time to Pabel, strengthening your bond.

Player_Romus

...find tranquility in nature.

Narrator

Though your paper resonated with those who knew of your former life, it received a lukewarm reception from academic circles. \n\nRegardless of their response, you found a profound sense of fulfillment in this endeavor, marking a new, more thoughtful chapter in your life.

Player_Romus

And there was finally peace.

Player_Romus

Those around you began referring to you affectionately as 'the Professor King'.

Narrator

You couldn't forget about Pabel in jail. And it looked like they wouldn't release him. Your heart was heavy and in pain that you couldn't erase.\n\nYou...

Narrator

But none came back.

Player_Romus

...partied with your old rich friends.

Player_Romus

Decided that your retirement was a time to focus on yourself.

Narrator

The long-awaited announcement came as a wave of relief: Rizia and Pales had reached a ceasefire, leading to a lasting peace. \n\nThe years had seen much loss, often for reasons that now seemed trivial. With the burden of these events no longer yours to bear, a sense of liberation settled within you.

Player_Romus

You were worried about the future.

Player_Romus

It was not your responsibility anymore, and that, in itself, felt good.

Player_Romus

..a collection of historical books, thoughtfully gifted by a friend.

Player_Romus

...a thesis your friend entrusted you to review.

Player_Romus

...the immediatist movement, studying their drive for swift change.

Player_Romus

...the healing effects of humor in society.

Player_Romus

...a letter from your mother, a testament of admiration.

Player_Romus

...embrace life's pleasures, celebrating every joyous occasion.

Narrator

Under Adarfo Sotelatoâ€™s leadership, the revolutionary government solidified, elevating him to a Prime Minister with tangible authority. \n\nDespite his ascendancy, factions were getting more extreme.

Narrator

You decamped to one of your family guest houses near Porte Drazon.

After a few weeks in isolation, you couldn't take it anymore. You put on a disguise and went into the Old Town to get some air.

Suddenly, out of nowhere, you heard a shout. "YOU MONSTER! YOU TOOK HER AWAY FROM ME!"

Player_Romus

Heeding her advice, you decided to leave.

Narrator

Mother had packed up everything. She told you that Queen Beatrice had offered you a safe haven in Rumburg.\n\nAlternately, you could escape to a villa by the beach in Kyrute.

Narrator

As Lucita Azaro ascended the throne as interim queen, you stood by her side as King Consort. Her popularity extended beyond Cardesse-Montaklar, overshadowing even your own legacy. \n\nIn her first address, she acknowledged your past contributions with graciousness.

Narrator

Hubertus Toras, ascending as monarch, faced skepticism beyond Valenqiris, evidenced by the subdued response to his coronation. \n\nDuring his first address, he devoted a considerable time to lauding your tenure.

Narrator

Rico Toras, your ambitious cousin, infused a newfound sense of nationalism and monarchism in Rizia. \n\nNotably, he made no mention of you in his coronation address.

Narrator

You watched the ceremony from seclusion. Death threats had begun arriving shortly after your abdication, and security advised you to keep a low profile.\n\nYou and your mother absconded to an estate on the outskirts of Porte Drazon, waiting for the news that you were safe at last.

Narrator

You lived out the rest of your days as King Emeritus of Rizia, commanding respect but little authority.

The day your son came of age, the golden Toras crown was placed upon his head.

You...

Player_Romus

...wished him the best of luck.

Player_Romus

...were reassured by the knowledge that the reign of House Toras would continue -- with or without you.

Narrator

You decamped to one of your family guest houses near Porte Drazon and waited for the air to clear.

Narrator

Vina, freed of the burden of carrying the Toras lineage forward, filed for divorce against Rico.

She visited you often. Now that you were no longer king, your bond felt stronger than ever.

You...
